p: The presence of cytologically homomorphic sex chromosomes that are nonetheless heteromorphic on the molecular scale has been shown in several other plant species ( Liu et al. 2004; Khattak, Torp, and Andersen 2006; Telgmann-Rauber et al. 2007), such as Spinacia oleracea, belonging to the same family as A. palmeri, that is, Amaranthaceae ( Khattak, Torp, and Andersen 2006).
